columns.text: In this exercise, we are to determine the projected retained earnings of the company.

## Pro Forma Statements
\
Pro Forma statements include a forecasted balance sheet, an income statement, and a statement of cash flows. These financial statements are necessary for the determination of the summary of projected events in the succeeding years of operation of the firm.
\
The pro forma statements are considered outputs of the financial plan. The management would estimate the projected and would then produce the pro forma statements.

## Retention Ratio
\
The retention ratio is referred to as the rate of the net income that is included in the retained earnings and is used to grow the business.

Now, let us determine the retained earnings using the following given:
 

<center>

|Given||
|:--|--:|
|Income Statement||
|$\hspace{20pt}$Sales|\$49,000|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Cost|\$40,300|
|$\hspace{30pt}$Taxable Income|\$8,700|
|$\hspace{30pt}$Tax Expenses (22\%)|\$1,914|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Net Income|\$6,786|
|Dividends|\$2,400|
|Addition to Retained Earnings|\$4,386|

Now, let us prepare the pro forma income statement:
 
$$\textbf{Pro Forma}\\
\textbf{Income Statement}$$

$$\begin{array}{l r}
\text{Sales}&{\$58,800}\\
\text{Cost}&\underline{48,216}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Taxable Income}&{\$10,584}\\
\hspace{10pt}\text{Taxes}&\underline{2,328.48}\\
\hspace{20pt}\textbf{Net Income}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$}\textbf{8,255.52}}}\\
\end{array}$$
The problem will require us to compute the projected addition to the retained earnings.

### Let's first provide the given data and income statement in the problem.

* The projected increase in sales is 20%.
* Dividends declared $2,400.00.
* Addition to retained earnings $4,386.00.


$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\textbf{Description}&\underline{\textbf{Amount}}\\[10pt]
\text{Sales}&\$49,000.00\\
\text{Cost of Sales}&\underline{40,300.00}\\
\text{Taxable Income}&8,700.00\\
\text{Taxes(22\%)}&\underline{1,914.00}\\
\textbf{Net Income}&\underline{\underline{\$6,786.00}}

\end{array}
$$

## Requirement.

### Compute the projected retained earnings.

### Compute the percentage of the cost of sales from the sales.

Computation of the percentage share of the cost of sales is needed to compute the cost of sales for the projected sales.

The formula is as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Percentage of Cost of Sales from Sales}&= \dfrac{ \text{Cost of Sales}}{\text{Sales}}\\[15pt]



\end{aligned}
$$

### Compute the cost of sales of the projected sales.

Using the calculated percentage of the cost of sales, we will use this percentage share to calculate the projected cost of sales.
$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Projected Cost of Sales}&= \text{Percentage Share of COS} \times \text{Projected Sales}\\[15pt]
\end{aligned}
$$

### Compute the taxable income.

The projected taxable income will be used in calculating the business tax.
$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\textbf{Description}&\underline{\textbf{Amount}}\\[10pt]
\text{Sales}&\$58,800.00\\
\text{Cost of Sales}&\underline{48,375.12}\\
\text{Taxable Income}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$10,424.88}}}\\
\end{array}
$$


Therefore, the taxable income is **$10,424.88**.

### Compute the share of retained earnings to the net income.

The share of retained earnings is calculated by dividing the retained earnings from the net income. This is known as the retention ratio.

The formula for the retention ratio is as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Retention Ratio}&= \dfrac{\text{Retained Earnings}}{\text{Net Income}}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{\$4,386.00}{\$6,786.00}\\[15pt]
&= 0.6463  \times 100\\[15pt]
&= \boxed{\textbf{64.63\%}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Therefore, the retention ratio is **64.63%**.
